title: Easter Island: Surreal travel experience
text:
Easter Island: Surreal travel experience Adv: 
By Marcus Edensky | Jul 19, 2015 Adv: 
Easter Island, also known as Rapa Nui, is a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its hundreds of gigantic moai statues scattered all over the island. It is a place where history meets legend in an almost surreal way. 
The world is fascinated by the creation of these statues not only for the impressive size and quantity of them, but also for the circumstances under which they were built. This small island had very limited resources - not much drinking water, no cattle, and no metal. And the statues were transported to their final location several kilometers across hilly terrain - all of this accomplished under the leadership of a tribal chieftain. 
The people of Rapa Nui people number at a mere 3,000, and they love to celebrate their culture through music, dance, and art. Today, Easter Island is a part of Chile, so there are strong South American influences on this Polynesian island. 
Since the 1990s, tourism has become a more common part of the Easter Island society, with people traveling from all over the world to experience this unique culture and see the monolithic moai sculptures. 
One travel company has, over the course of the latest year, has started offering a wider array of tours in response to demand, and it has received special attention for its focus on adventure tours, in which travelers go horseback riding for days, and camp in the wilderness under the stars and in caves. Easter Island Travel 's many happy customers have spread the word about its services, which has helped it grow greatly, and their votes ranked this domain as the #1 Easter Island tour agency on TripAdvisor.
